title: Geometric sans with ligatures and flourishes
content:
Hello wise ones.

Does any one know where I’ll find some contemporary geometric fonts which have flourishes or ligatures? I really like Brant Pro 2 but wish it had a bit more personality.

[http://www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant2/b02.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20091108153242/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant2/b02.html "http://www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant2/b02.html")

Many thanks,

Alex
author: Alex Parrott

comments.content:
Is Jeremy Tankard’s Aspect geometric enough?  
 [http://typography.net/type/aspect.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20091108153242/http:/typography.net/type/aspect.htm "http://typography.net/type/aspect.htm") \<— seems to be down at the moment  
 [http://www.faces.co.uk/fonts/Jeremy-Tankard/Aspect-JT02/](http://web.archive.org/web/20091108153242/http:/www.faces.co.uk/fonts/Jeremy-Tankard/Aspect-JT02/ "http://www.faces.co.uk/fonts/Jeremy-Tankard/Aspect-JT02/")
It’s a great start – thanks altaira. Any other suggestions welcome.

You’re welcome. You may also want to peruse the links in these older threads:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/50159](http://web.archive.org/web/20091108153242/http:/typophile.com/node/50159 "http://typophile.com/node/50159")  
 [http://typophile.com/node/42274](http://web.archive.org/web/20091108153242/http:/typophile.com/node/42274 "http://typophile.com/node/42274")
